definition[0]: to destroy something completely so that nothing remains
example[0]: Hiroshima was nearly obliterated by the atomic bomb.
definition[1]: to remove a thought, feeling, or memory from someoneâ€™s mind
example[1]: Nothing could obliterate the memory of those tragic events.
definition[2]: to cover something completely so that it cannot be seen
example[2]: Then the fog came down, obliterating everything.
